The University of Wisconsin: Madison Chancellor implemented a two-week lockdown due to rapidly rising COVID-19 cases, including a high positivity rate among student tests.
Wisconsin ranks 30th in COVID: 19 cases per capita over the entirety of the pandemic.
In the week leading up to the statement: Wisconsin had the fifth-highest rate of new cases per capita in the country.
The New York Times analysis identified W: with Wisconsin ranking fifth in the number of new cases per capita over the last seven days.
